text: Hi everyone, I'm still getting to know HubSpot and it's design manager, I'm almost finishing creating a custom page with the Drag and Drop builder but I can't manage to create a mobile navigation that works (converts to the hamburger menu on a given device width). Anyone knows the easiest way to do this or if there is a code snippet to add a mobile navigation? Thanks in advance.

:wave: Aldo, you can use this as a reference: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/snippets/responsive/how-to-implement-a-fixed-top-mobile-navigation-design-manager>

There are also some snippets in the code gallery for menus that may be a good starting point as well: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/code-gallery/projects/menus-and-navigation>
Not a problem! Always happy to help :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey all! We're using the A/B testing features on HubSpot, but trying to find a way to track EACH variation on GA or GTM, based on custom events. Has anyone  used A/B testing on HubSpot and found a creative way to measure results outside of HubSpot?
Have a slightly different template for each version and track each one seperatly
so technically have two separate landing pages? How do you split the traffic?
